definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: I don't know, a very English, sort of stiff upper lip kind of man.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道，一個英國式的，堅定沉穩的男人。

sentences.english: Always the calm Jia Xiuquan unexpectedly so high-sounding talk, really makes one express admiration.
sentences.chinese: 一向沉穩的賈秀全竟然如此高調，實在令人稱奇。

sentences.english: The ride was momentous, historical, and calm.
sentences.chinese: 這次乘車聲勢浩大，是歷史性的，而且異常沉穩。

sentences.english: White flowers Mazumdar, safflower calm, elegant purple flower.
sentences.chinese: 白花素潔，紅花沉穩，紫花淡雅。

sentences.english: Somewhat less rash and hair-leng, a little more steady and heavy.
sentences.chinese: 少了幾分輕率與毛楞，多了幾分沉穩與厚重。

sentences.english: The other side was like the composed personality of the kings.
sentences.chinese: 一邊是帝王將相般的沉穩大氣。

sentences.english: Burros are known for their sure footing on mountains while carrying heavy loads.
sentences.chinese: 小驢因它們在山路上載重時的沉穩步伐而廣爲人知。

sentences.english: Glass skirting, what modern feeling, elegant and steady, full of personality .
sentences.chinese: 玻璃裙邊，極具現代感，優雅沉穩，個性實足。

sentences.english: Bass player Wangdan, he always keep sedate and independent on living life and same on music.
sentences.chinese: 貝斯手王丹在生活和音樂中都會保持一份沉穩和獨立。

sentences.english: Feeding at the side of the flowers and get calm, he told the mother.
sentences.chinese: 在一旁飼弄花草的母親沉穩的說道。

sentences.english: By keeping physical intactness, it is possible to have a composed, tranquil and peaceful heart.
sentences.chinese: 形全之後，一顆沉穩寧靜的心纔有可能實現。

sentences.english: The modeling styles of orthodox academic school steadfastly construct the narrative space.
sentences.chinese: 正統學院派的造型形式，沉穩地構架起敘事空間場景。

sentences.english: The middle-aged woman 's style is a kind of mature and steady.
sentences.chinese: 中年女人的風采表現爲一種成熟和沉穩。
